In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **T** serves the following purposes:

- t represents a t [lurker above](/wiki/Lurker_above "Lurker above") or t [trapper](/wiki/Trapper "Trapper"), which are the sole members of the [trapper or lurker above](/wiki/Trapper_or_lurker_above "Trapper or lurker above") monster class.

* T represents a [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)"):

  - T [troll](/wiki/Troll "Troll")
  - T [ice troll](/wiki/Ice_troll "Ice troll")
  - T [rock troll](/wiki/Rock_troll "Rock troll")
  - T [water troll](/wiki/Water_troll "Water troll")
  - T [Olog-hai](/wiki/Olog-hai "Olog-hai")

- Press [t]() to [throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw") something.
- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [t]() to [take off](/wiki/Take_off "Take off") [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor").
- Press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [t]() to [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") if you have the means to do so.

* On the [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line"), T stands for time, or [turns](/wiki/Turn "Turn").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), teleporters used the t glyph, while trolls used the T glyph. In [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the t glyph is given to the [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu"), while the troll retains its glyph.

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the tengu is moved to the [imp or minor demon](/wiki/Imp_or_minor_demon "Imp or minor demon") monster class, which uses the i glyph, while the trapper (formerly , is moved to the t glyph in its place alongside the lurker above. The troll still retains its glyph, and various other trolls are introduced.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds two new monsters that use the T glyph:

- T troll

  - T [two-headed troll](/wiki/Two-headed_troll "Two-headed troll")
  - T [black troll](/wiki/Black_troll "Black troll")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several new monsters that use the t and T glyphs:

- t trapper or lurker above

  - t [baby metroid](/wiki/Baby_metroid "Baby metroid")
  - t [metroid](/wiki/Metroid "Metroid")
  - t [alpha metroid](/wiki/Alpha_metroid "Alpha metroid")
  - t [gamma metroid](/wiki/Gamma_metroid "Gamma metroid")
  - t [zeta metroid](/wiki/Zeta_metroid "Zeta metroid")
  - t [omega metroid](/wiki/Omega_metroid "Omega metroid")
  - t [metroid queen](/wiki/Metroid_queen "Metroid queen")
  - t [mouth of the goat](/index.php?title=Mouth_of_the_goat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mouth of the goat (page does not exist)")

- T troll
  - T [wood troll](/wiki/Wood_troll "Wood troll")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds two monsters that use the T glyph:

- T [cave troll](/index.php?title=Cave_troll\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Cave troll (page does not exist)")
- T [grave troll](/index.php?title=Grave_troll\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grave troll (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds one new monster that uses the t glyphs:

- t [labyrinth trapper](/wiki/Labyrinth_trapper "Labyrinth trapper")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds some new monsters from other variants that use the T glyph:

- T [two-headed troll](/wiki/Two-headed_troll "Two-headed troll")
- T [grave troll](/index.php?title=Grave_troll\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grave troll (page does not exist)")
- T [black troll](/wiki/Black_troll "Black troll")
- T [cave troll](/index.php?title=Cave_troll\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Cave troll (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

T

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter T serves the following purposes:

  • t represents a t lurker above or t trapper, which are the sole members of the trapper or lurker above monster class.
  • T represents a troll:
    • T troll
    • T ice troll
    • T rock troll
    • T water troll
    • T Olog-hai
  • Press t to throw something.
  • Press shift + t to take off armor.
  • Press ctrl + t to teleport if you have the means to do so.
  • On the status line, T stands for time, or turns.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 SpliceHack
    • 2.4 SlashTHEM
    • 2.5 Hack'EM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, teleporters used the t glyph, while trolls used the T glyph. In Hack 1.0, the t glyph is given to the tengu, while the troll retains its glyph.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the tengu is moved to the imp or minor demon monster class, which uses the i glyph, while the trapper (formerly , is moved to the t glyph in its place alongside the lurker above. The troll still retains its glyph, and various other trolls are introduced.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds two new monsters that use the T glyph:

  • T troll
    • T two-headed troll
    • T black troll

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the t and T glyphs:

  • t trapper or lurker above
    • t baby metroid
    • t metroid
    • t alpha metroid
    • t gamma metroid
    • t zeta metroid
    • t omega metroid
    • t metroid queen
    • t mouth of the goat
  • T troll
    • T wood troll

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds two monsters that use the T glyph:

  • T cave troll
  • T grave troll

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds one new monster that uses the t glyphs:

  • t labyrinth trapper

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds some new monsters from other variants that use the T glyph:

  • T two-headed troll
  • T grave troll
  • T black troll
  • T cave troll

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''T''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|t}} represents a {{monsymlink|lurker above}} or {{monsymlink|trapper}}, which are the sole members of the [[trapper or lurker above]] monster class.

* {{white|T}} represents a [[Troll (monster class)|troll]]:
** {{monsymlink|troll}}
** {{monsymlink|ice troll}}
** {{monsymlink|rock troll}}
** {{monsymlink|water troll}}
** {{monsymlink|Olog-hai}}

* Press {{kbd|t}} to [[throw]] something.
* Press {{kbd|shift|t}} to [[take off]] [[armor]].
* Press {{kbd|ctrl|t}} to [[teleport]] if you have the means to do so.

* On the [[status line]], T stands for time, or [[turn]]s.

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], teleporters used the {{white|t}} glyph, while trolls used the {{white|T}} glyph. In [[Hack 1.0]], the {{white|t}} glyph is given to the [[tengu]], while the troll retains its glyph.

In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], the tengu is moved to the [[imp or minor demon]] monster class, which uses the {{white|i}} glyph, while the trapper (formerly {{white|,}} is moved to the {{white|t}} glyph in its place alongside the lurker above. The troll still retains its glyph, and various other trolls are introduced.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|T}} glyph:

* {{white|T}} troll
** {{monsymlink|two-headed troll}}
** {{monsymlink|black troll}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] adds several new monsters that use the {{white|t}} and {{white|T}} glyphs:

* {{white|t}} trapper or lurker above
** {{green|t}} [[baby metroid]]
** {{brightgreen|t}} [[metroid]]
** {{red|t}} [[alpha metroid]]
** {{orange|t}} [[gamma metroid]]
** {{yellow|t}} [[zeta metroid]]
** {{brightmagenta|t}} [[omega metroid]]
** {{magenta|t}} [[metroid queen]]
** {{black|t}} [[mouth of the goat]]
* {{white|T}} troll
** {{green|T}} [[wood troll]]

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds two monsters that use the {{white|T}} glyph:

* {{brown|T}} [[cave troll]]
* {{gray|T}} [[grave troll]]

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds one new monster that uses the {{white|t}} glyphs:

* {{magenta|t}} [[labyrinth trapper]]

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds some new monsters from other variants that use the {{white|T}} glyph:

* {{monsymlink|two-headed troll}}
* {{gray|T}} [[grave troll]]
* {{monsymlink|black troll}}
* {{brown|T}} [[cave troll]]
{{nethack-367}}
